channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Scott Morrison says social distancing won't apply to schools, global COVID-19 cases surpass 2.7 million, Australian death toll stands at 78

item.description: Suspected Hutu militiamen have killed 16 people, including 12 rangers, in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo's Virunga National Park.
item.title: Twelve park rangers among 16 killed in Virunga National Park ambush

item.description: At 21, my great-grandfather was serving in the dog days of WWI. For 12 months, he sent letters of love, pain and all that fell in between, to his Katherine.
item.title: In 1918, Jim wrote letters to his sweetheart. Last month, I opened them

item.dc:creator: Stephanie Darling
item.description: Not sure how to tint and shape your eyebrows yourself? Here's an at-home step-by-step for better brows.
item.title: A guide to taming your untidy brows at home

item.description: Keeping a diary is not only a good way to talk to yourself, it also allows for much-needed self-reflection.
item.title: How taking just five minutes a day to write can help you through the crisis

item.description: The shooting rampage started with an assault by the suspect on his girlfriend and ended with 22 people dead, police say.
item.title: Canada's worst mass shooting erupted from gunman's assault on girlfriend

item.description: Regulators flagged reports of serious side effects and death among patients taking hydroxychloroquine and the related drug chloroquine.
item.title: FDA warns of risks with Trump-promoted malaria drug

item.description: The parent company of Dettol disinfectant has warned that its products should not be used internally to treat COVID-19 after Donald Trump wondered about the prospect during a White House briefing.
item.title: Don't inject disinfectants, Dettol warns, as Trump raises the idea

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: A week in photos from the award winning Sydney Morning Herald / The Age / Financial Review photographers.
item.title: Photos of the week, April 23, 2020

item.dc:creator: Clay Lucas
item.description: Could the pandemic provide a sort of reset, where Daniel Andrews relaxes his focus on big builds and turns to other infrastructure to get the economy pumping?
item.title: The road to recovery: Are Victoria's mega-projects still worth it?

item.dc:creator: John Silvester
item.description: When the gang brought out a US Hells Angels hitman to kill two local police, they nabbed him at Melbourne Airport, urinated on his club jacket and chucked him on the next plane out – telling him to piss off - literally.
item.title: Who says crime doesn't pay? Welcome to the Naked City podcast

item.dc:creator: Konrad Marshall
item.description: She's one of the AFLW's most exciting players, and a lightning rod for the movement against online abuse. But now, like the rest of us, she's in isolation. Meet Tayla Harris, star interrupted.
item.title: Making her mark: how a photo brought Aussie Rules star Tayla Harris' A game to the trolls

item.dc:creator: Tony Wright
item.description: On Anzac Day 2020, the Gallipoli Peninsula is deserted as the world retreats to save itself from a new global threat.
item.title: Old battlefield falls silent as a new struggle is fought in solitude

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: After its hopes of help from the Morrison government were dashed, Virgin Australia has no easy way back into the air.
item.title: The week that Virgin Australia hit the ground hard

item.description: In later life “Bluey” was reluctant to talk about the war. But he and the girl he met while AWOL in London on April 25, 1916, both had stories to tell.
item.title: How Bluey met Jo on the very first Anzac Day

item.dc:creator: Amanda Hooton
item.description: The laborious lockdown means children are being taught by their parents – who appear to be learning just as much as their young charges.
item.title: Home school of hard knocks: the diary of a WFH mother

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: Party may stand down workers as its finances fall victim to COVID-19 crisis
item.title: State Liberals may apply for JobKeeper as virus leaves party finances ailing

item.dc:creator: Adele Ferguson
item.description: AMP is heading for a strike at its annual general meeting on May 8 as a trifecta of proxy advisers recommend investors vote no on the embattled group's remuneration report.
item.title: AMP faces an investor revolt over 'excessive' remuneration package

item.dc:creator: Carrie Fellner
item.description: Australia's pandemic plans allow for regional cities to reopen before Sydney - but could it unleash a second wave in the bush?
item.title: 'Give it a whirl': regional cities call for trial of relaxed restrictions

item.dc:creator: Nathanael Cooper
item.description: The Rubens would normally be playing two-up together on Anzac Day – but this isn't a normal Anzac Day.
item.title: Musicians join forces on an Anzac Day unlike any other

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: When I was a little boy, my father, a World War II veteran, taught me a poem I recite every Anzac Day.
item.title: The Anzac spirit guides us as we find our way through this crisis

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: Long-term impacts are expected in children who experienced the summer bushfires because of a lack of support services after the disaster.
item.title: 'Systematic failing': Children need special services in bushfire aftermath

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: The Foreign Affairs Minister has stepped into the limelight to push Australia's diplomatic weight on the world stage.
item.title: The quiet diplomacy of Marise Payne

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Saturday, April 25

item.dc:creator: George Megalogenis
item.description: The PM doesn't fit neatly into the narrative the world's media is crafting - and his manner doesn't help.
item.title: Scott Morrison has a good story to tell but the world isn't listening

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Farrelly
item.description: The NSW government has cleared the way for stroke-of-a-pen development approvals. Trust it if you dare.
item.title: The lucky group enjoying fewer constraints under COVID: developers

item.dc:creator: Deborah Snow
item.description: Australia is one of the few countries in the world where suppression has worked so well governments are looking for ways to ease the burden of lockdowns.
item.title: The small steps Australia will take towards the goal of easing the lockdown

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: Australian Ethical is asking the biotech giant to clarify how it will manage the risks posed by people in the US making donations more frequently to supplement their income.
item.title: CSL's blood payments in US under the microscope

item.description: On Anzac Day, let us all take some quiet time in our isolation to remember those brave men and women who heroically risked their lives in the wars throughout Australia’s history.
item.title: To those lost in and after wars: thank you for your sacrifice

item.dc:creator: Nicole Lindsay
item.description: ST. ALi coffee king Salvatore Malatesta is set to open a new coffee outlet at the University of Melbourne’s new $200 million arts campus in Southbank.
item.title: Back to uni for ST. ALi coffee graduate

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: A post-virus slump in demand for office space may double vacancy rates in key Sydney and Melbourne, analysts say.
item.title: Expect sharp rise in office vacancies as jobs disappear

item.description: The original buildings at Toorak College's Mt Eliza campus have a majestic quality, surrounded by Edna Walling gardens.
item.title: Architecture that seeks to empower young women

item.description: When casualties and deaths are counted, the Gallipoli campaign exacted a much greater toll on the enemy. Every soldier I know would pick Gallipoli over Ypres or the Somme, any day, twice on Sunday.
item.title: On the grim arithmetic of war, Gallipoli cannot be dismissed as a colossal waste

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: The coronavirus was a health story. It is now an economic story. Before we know it, it will become a geo-strategic story and Australia has a blind spot.
item.title: Australia's China challenge in the post-coronavirus world

item.dc:creator: Kerrie O'Brien
item.description: Managing kids while juggling full-time work is no mean feat. Here are five books devised to help.
item.title: Top five parenting books to help you through tricky times

item.description: The lockdown reminds us that work plays an important social role in bringing people together.
item.title: Me and my moggy, just another day not at the office

item.description: Chickens are not egg machines. They are complex and they have needs. So we've rounded up some practical tips to keep your chooks happy – and productive.
item.title: So, you've panic bought chickens. Here's what you need to know

item.description: With a range of perspectives, these podcasts offer some of the best audio chats available.
item.title: Five of the best talk-based podcasts

item.description: The week in photos from award-winning Sydney Morning Herald photographers.
item.title: Photos of the week

item.dc:creator: Danny Katz
item.description: Molecular changes were happening inside me: I started craving whiskey, wanted to build a lute, needed to track down a local stockist for imported maple.
item.title: Thanks for the hat! It’s great! I love it! Did you keep the receipt?

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Many private school students will have more than twice as much face-to-face teaching in term two as their public school counterparts.
item.title: Back-to-school plan gives private students HSC advantage, educators warn

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: Richard Pusey is in protective custody after being condemned by senior police and politicians over allegations he taunted a dying policewomen after a horrific freeway crash that left four officers dead.
item.title: Mortgage broker in protective custody after condemnation over deadly crash

item.description: Slam front door as you leave the house with every intention of exercising, realise the pool is still closed and you’ll get arrested if you drive to the beach. Weep. At least you’re doing it outdoors.
item.title: What everybody claims they're doing in lockdown vs reality...

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: Government workers face a rising tide of violence and aggression, with young women and health workers bearing the brunt.
item.title: 'Code blue': Women, healthcare workers on state's violent front line

item.dc:creator: Adam Cooper
item.description: Leading lawyers say judge-only trials will keep the wheels of justice moving in Victoria, but warn they could heap more pressure onto the bench.
item.title: Judge-only trials welcomed but lawyers say more appeals are likely

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: Despite huge cash reserves, Cricket Australia chief executive Kevin Roberts warned last month that the dollars could disappear quicker than a legside full toss.
item.title: Howzat possible? Cricket Australia says big hits will keep coming

item.dc:creator: Linda Morris
item.description: Professor Kristofer Helgen has helped name more than 100 mammals, including the Skywalker hoolock gibbon.
item.title: Ain't nothing but mammals for new Australian Museum chief scientist

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Geelong teenager Olivia Purcell won the Cats' AFLW best and fairest in just her second season while North Melbourne's Jasmine Garner confirmed her star status at the Roos.
item.title: Purcell's rise continues at Cats, Kangaroos crown Garner

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news
